Goal/Summary: verify the software will not accept a GET request at /hash
actual result: 405 method not allowed GET Not Supported

Goal/Summary: verify the software will  accept a correctly formtted POST request at /hash
Steps: send a POST request to /hash containing a password
expected result: 201 Created and a job id is generated
actual result: 200 OK and a job id is generated (1)
notes: ideally the response should be a 201 to be more accurate.

Goal/Summary: verify user is able to send GET request to /hash/{jobid} and reveive a hash
Prerequisite: Test 2 has been ran and passed
expected result: 200 OK and a has is returned

Goal/Summary: verify the software will not accept a PUT request at /hash/{jobid}
Prerequisite: Test 2 has been ran and passed
actual result: 405 method not allowed PUT Not Supported

Goal/Summary: verify the software will not accept a PATCH request at /hash/{jobid}
Prerequisite: Test 2 has been ran and passed
actual result: 405 method not allowed PATCH Not Supported

Goal/Summary: verify the software will not accept a DELETE request at /hash/{jobid}
Prerequisite: Test 2 has been ran and passed
actual result: 405 method not allowed DELETE Not Supported

Goal/Summary: verify user is unable to send POST request to /hash with incorrect parameters
Steps: send a POST request to /hash containing something other than a password
actual result: 200 OK and a job id is generated (3) and a hash was also created as a result (z4PhNX7vuL3xVChQ1m2AB9Yg5AULVxXcg/SpIdNs6c5H0NE8XYXysP+DGNKHfuwvY7kxvUdBeoGlODJ6+SfaPg==)

Goal/Summary: verify user is unable to send a GET request for a hash that does not exist
Steps: send a GET request to /hash/{jobid} for an ID that doesn’t exist

Goal/Summary: verify user is able to send GET request to /stats and request stats are returned
Prerequisite: Test 2 has been ran and passed
expected result: 200 OK and request stats are returned

Goal/Summary: verify user is unable to send POST request to /stats
verify user is able to send GET request to /stats and request stats are returned even when no hashes have been created
Prerequisite: start a fresh session with no existing hashes
expected result: 200 OK and request stats are returned

Goal/Summary: verify software can handle multiple requests in parallel
Steps: send multiple POST requests to /hash containing a password in parallel
expected result: 200 OK and the correct number of job ids are created

Steps:
1. send multiple POST requests to /hash containing a password in parallel
2. while the requests are still running run the shutdown request
example requests/data:
1. xargs -I % -P 10 curl --location --request POST 'localhost:8088/hash' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"password":"Testing123"}' < <(printf '%s\n' {1..400})
2. curl -X POST -d 'shutdown' http://localhost:8088/hash
expected result: 200 OK, software allows any in-flight hashing to complete, software rejects any new requests
notes: software does NOT reject new requests and waits till the requests are finished before shutting down

Goal/Summary: verify software will not accept requests after software has successfully shutdown
Steps:
1. run the shutdown command
2. send a POST request to /hash containing a password
example requests/data:
1. curl -X POST -d 'shutdown' http://localhost:8088/hash
2. curl --location --request POST 'localhost:8088/hash' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-raw '{"password":"Testing123"}'
